description: Apparently an alteration (after penny) of Anglo-Norman puliol royal, from Latin pÅ«legium.

entries.meaning: Mentha pulegium, a plant of the mint family, formerly much used in various medicinal treatments and as a flea repellent.
examples: Dioscorides says that Pennyroyal makes thin, tough phlegm, warms the coldness of any part whereto it is applied, and digests raw or corrupt matter.
